Above an Open Grave
  You climb up the edge of the wall until you find the ledge and pull
yourself up. You're outside now, but it's still quite dark. There are two
yellow, crescent moons shining from above a house up ahead, gently lighting
up the ground around you. You turn around to realize that what you've
crawled out of is actually a grave. In fact, this entire area reeks of
decomposing waste.  You're in a graveyard!

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Crudely Carved Passage (G)
  It is pitch black, and you wait a moment for your eyes to adjust so you
can get your bearings.  You soon realize that you are in the middle of some
sort of Sahuagin stronghold.  The passage you stand in leads off in various
directions.  The faint shrieks pain and death coming from beyond the stone
walls send tremors of apprehension through your body.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south (down) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 4602/4602 HP  4125/4980 MP  1847/1847 mv  449tnl  
Lv 155  G 556949 | Crudely Carved Passage (S[D])
>>
s
Dim Stronghold Passage
  You continue deeper into the stronghold and find it necessary to duck
behind a niche from time to time to hide.  Females and guards are just some
of the Sahuagin that pass by completely unaware of your presence.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east ]
     (Invis) A soggy ledger containing your assets is drying here.
(Red Aura) An accountant is taking inventory of the room.

[*Daily Blessing*] 4602/4602 HP  4125/4980 MP  1843/1847 mv  449tnl  
Lv 155  G 556949 | Dim Stronghold Passage (NE)
>>


e
e
Shark-filled Passage
  Bloodthirsty sharks besiege you from all sides of this dark hallway. 
Bones of unfortunate victims lay scattered on the rocky floor.  The sound of
voices catches your attention to the south.  Your curiosity urges you to
head in that direction, but you will have to overcome the shark horde first.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]

Lv 155  G 556949 | Shark-filled Passage (ESW)
>>
Treasure Strongroom
    Plundered crates of ill-fated ships are stacked high to the ceilings.  A
few have fallen and broken, spilling their contents of dishes and metal
trinkets all over the sandy floor.  You notice some backpacks, slit of their
contents and some discarded elven weapons lying nearby as well.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
     Gold coins spill from a broken crate.

Council Chamber of the Prince
  This dim chamber is similar to the others you have wandered through, only
that it is larger in size.  Hard, stone chairs, that look as if they were
chiseled from blocks of stone, are scattered throughout the room.  What
looks to be a map of some sorts is scrawled on one of the walls.

looks to be a map of some sorts is scrawled on one of the walls.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north west ]
(Red Aura) An accountant is taking inventory of the room.

[*Daily Blessing*] 4602/4602 HP  4201/4980 MP  1807/1847 mv  449tnl  
Lv 155  G 556949 | Council Chamber of the Prince (NW)
>>
w
Lair of Prince Azhirlur
  You are surprised when you enter the lair and see a colorful tapestry
hanging on the dreary stone wall.  Even more peculiar are the figurines of
gold and the bowls of fine china that sit on the primitive table in the
center of the room.  It is an obvious contrast to the other dark and gloomy
rooms you have come across in this stronghold.  The tenant of this lair is
undeniably one who is unusually fascinated by the items that have been
seized from his victims.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east down ]
(Red Aura) An accountant is taking inventory of the room.
(Red Aura) Prince Azhirlur's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) Prince Azhirlur's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) Prince Azhirlur's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) Prince Azhirlur's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) Prince Azhirlur admires a trinket from the latest plunder.

>>
d
An Ominous Vestibule
  You descend deeper into the Sahuagin caverns and now find yourself in a
broad corridor that branches off in different directions.  A malevolent
darkness encompasses you, instilling a sense of uncertain uneasiness as you
quietly carry on with your mission.

n
Imposing Corridor
  The pitch-dark corridor continues with nothing but rough, featureless
stone walls looming over you on all sides.  In spite of the lackluster
surroundings, the butterflies in your stomach intensify as you move forward
into the sinister blackness ahead.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south (west) ]
(Translucent) (Red Aura) A servant rushes past you as if she was chased by sharks.
(Translucent) (Red Aura) A servant rushes past you as if she was chased by sharks.

[*Daily Blessing*] 4602/4602 HP  4201/4980 MP  1795/1847 mv  449tnl  
Lv 155  G 556949 | Imposing Corridor (ES[W])
>>
e
Grand Antechamber of the Sahuagin Palace
  The gloomy, stone walls rise above into a high, expansive dome that
vanishes into an inky darkness.  The lichen clinging to the stone gives off
a faint, sickly glow.  Monumental statues, carved from black, volcanic rock
are displayed on either side of you.  Each portrays a distorted, grotesque
Sahuagin and sharks performing horrific acts of torture to sea elves,
tritons and mermen.  The pure sense of evil that emanates from this chamber
causes you to sweat even in these underwater conditions.  To your north are
heavily-guarded, colossal coral-inlaid doors.  Guessing by the size of the
Sahuagin standing guard on either side, you get the feeling that something
of great importance is on the other side of those doors.  The deep black
eyes of the very large guard standing directly in front of the door fall on
you, leaving you with a twisting, nauseous feeling in your gut.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) west ]
(Red Aura) A stern looking custodian blocks your way.
(Red Aura) This shark circles the room.
(Red Aura) A tall, broad sahuagin looks down at you.
(Red Aura) A tall, broad sahuagin looks down at you.
(Red Aura) A tall, broad sahuagin looks down at you.
(Red Aura) A tall, broad sahuagin looks down at you.

[*Daily Blessing*] 4602/4602 HP  4290/4980 MP  1839/1847 mv  449tnl  
Lv 155  G 556949 | Imposing Corridor (ESW)
>>
Concubine Seraglio
  Paramours of the king linger in these chambers until their services are
required.  They recline on a floor covered with a bedding made up of tossed
seaweed and sea grass.  Bioluminescent lichen growing in the cracks of the
stone wall gives the room an almost provocative ambience.  The females here
preen their black, scaly skin and fins rubbing themselves in fish blood, a
practice that only a Sahuagin male would find enticing.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) A disturbing sahuagin relaxes here, waiting for a suitor to arrive.

[*Daily Blessing*] 4602/4602 HP  4290/4980 MP  1827/1847 mv  449tnl  
Lv 155  G 556949 | An Ominous Vestibule (NEW)
>>
Sahuagin Service Chamber
  This dismal, cramped cave houses the domestic staff of the palace. 
Workers scurry in and out, performing various duties for the king and his
nobles.  You glance around the meager cave and find only some food scraps
and seaweed mats.  Bloodstains in the corner and the walls are a reminder to
the laborers that the king is not a patient creature and will not tolerate
being displeased.  A spot next to the bloodstains seems to be a tunnel.

<MAPEND>

e
Grand Antechamber of the Sahuagin Palace
  The gloomy, stone walls rise above into a high, expansive dome that
vanishes into an inky darkness.  The lichen clinging to the stone gives off
a faint, sickly glow.  Monumental statues, carved from black, volcanic rock
are displayed on either side of you.  Each portrays a distorted, grotesque
Sahuagin and sharks performing horrific acts of torture to sea elves,
tritons and mermen.  The pure sense of evil that emanates from this chamber
causes you to sweat even in these underwater conditions.  To your north are
heavily-guarded, colossal coral-inlaid doors.  Guessing by the size of the
Sahuagin standing guard on either side, you get the feeling that something
of great importance is on the other side of those doors.  The deep black
eyes of the very large guard standing directly in front of the door fall on
you, leaving you with a twisting, nauseous feeling in your gut.  

<MAPEND>

(Red Aura) A tall, broad sahuagin looks down at you.
(Red Aura) A tall, broad sahuagin looks down at you.

vanishes into an inky darkness.  The lichen clinging to the stone gives off
a faint, sickly glow.  Monumental statues, carved from black, volcanic rock
are displayed on either side of you.  Each portrays a distorted, grotesque

causes you to sweat even in these underwater conditions.  To your north are

eyes of the very large guard standing directly in front of the door fall on

s
Grand Antechamber of the Sahuagin Palace
  The gloomy, stone walls rise above into a high, expansive dome that
vanishes into an inky darkness.  The lichen clinging to the stone gives off
a faint, sickly glow.  Monumental statues, carved from black, volcanic rock
are displayed on either side of you.  Each portrays a distorted, grotesque
Sahuagin and sharks performing horrific acts of torture to sea elves,
tritons and mermen.  The pure sense of evil that emanates from this chamber
causes you to sweat even in these underwater conditions.  To your north are
heavily-guarded, colossal coral-inlaid doors.  Guessing by the size of the
Sahuagin standing guard on either side, you get the feeling that something
of great importance is on the other side of those doors.  The deep black
eyes of the very large guard standing directly in front of the door fall on
you, leaving you with a twisting, nauseous feeling in your gut.  

<MAPEND>

>>
Sahuagin Service Chamber
  This dismal, cramped cave houses the domestic staff of the palace. 
Workers scurry in and out, performing various duties for the king and his
nobles.  You glance around the meager cave and find only some food scraps
and seaweed mats.  Bloodstains in the corner and the walls are a reminder to
the laborers that the king is not a patient creature and will not tolerate
being displeased.  A spot next to the bloodstains seems to be a tunnel.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

can get your bearings.  You soon realize that you are in the middle of some
sort of Sahuagin stronghold.  The passage you stand in leads off in various
directions.  The faint shrieks pain and death coming from beyond the stone
walls send tremors of apprehension through your body.

Lair of Prince Azhirlur
  You are surprised when you enter the lair and see a colorful tapestry
hanging on the dreary stone wall.  Even more peculiar are the figurines of
gold and the bowls of fine china that sit on the primitive table in the
center of the room.  It is an obvious contrast to the other dark and gloomy
rooms you have come across in this stronghold.  The tenant of this lair is
undeniably one who is unusually fascinated by the items that have been
seized from his victims.

>>
w
Breeding Cave
  Female Sahuagin wander in and out of this rustic cave.  Some lay waiting
on seaweed mats waiting for their master and prince to come impregnate them.
Others are here to deposit their eggs or care for their hatchlings.  You
shudder as you notice a pile of dead hatchlings in the corner of the room. 
The Sahuagin are not ones to tolerate weakness.  Guards enter the cave to
inspect the new hatchlings, pluck any with noticeable imperfections and slam
them against the walls of the cave before tossing their tiny bodies into the
pile that will later be used as shark food.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) (White Aura) This female sahuagin spends her time with the young.
(Red Aura) This young hatchling is hungry for meat.
(Red Aura) This young hatchling is hungry for meat.

Council Chamber of the Prince
  This dim chamber is similar to the others you have wandered through, only
that it is larger in size.  Hard, stone chairs, that look as if they were
chiseled from blocks of stone, are scattered throughout the room.  What
looks to be a map of some sorts is scrawled on one of the walls.  

<MAPEND>

[*Daily Blessing*] 4602/4602 HP  4016/4980 MP  1827/1847 mv  433tnl  
Lv 155  G 556949 | Council Chamber of the Prince (NE)
>>
Lair of Prince Tumek
  You have come face to face with the formidable figure of one of the
Sahuagin princes.  He is surrounded by several guards and more of the same
sharks that you fought in the alcove.  It is not luxurious quarters that
this prince resides in.  The walls are more of the rough, cold dark stone
that makes up the rest of the stronghold.  They glow softly with a
bioluminescence that is emitted from small sea bacteria.  Behind him hangs a
skull of shark, with his large jaws open as if the long dead animal is
reaching to devour you.  On one side of the room is a carved, stone table. 
Some bloodied, barbaric daggers lay alongside a bowl that looks to be filled
with body parts of unfortunate prisoners.  A rack of tridents and spears
hangs on the wall on the one side of him.  You send a quick prayer to your
deity as you prepare to meet this foe who is now staring coldly at you.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west down ]
(Red Aura) This female sahuagin spends her time with the young.
(Red Aura) Prince Tumek's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) Prince Tumek's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) Prince Tumek's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) Prince Tumek's bodyguard keeps a wary eye on you.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) Prince Tumek quickly deems your presence a mere trifle.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Road before the small village (G)
  The woods finally clear as you approach a small village surrounded by a
small wall and with only a few buildings present. The hot sun beats down on
you as you see a desert far to the east. This appears to be the last stop
before the desert.  It might be a good idea to stock up on supplies before
traveling any further.

Entrance Way
  Quickly running inside to shield you from the harsh desert winds you realize 
that you are in the Desert Prison. The Famed prison of which if anyone 
escapes will die from the desert. On either side of you, you see two fresh 
water springs that help make the prison self- sufficient in the desert. The 
nicely carved stones decorate the hall. You see the ramp proceed down to the 
prison. This was built that way to help cool the prison.

Main Hallway
  More cells, well this is a prison, of course there will be cells.  The
moaning of the prisoners sends chills down your back, as you realize that
you could save them, or leave there here to die in these little cells.  To
the south you can see an intersection of this hall and the south hall.  Cells
stretch to the east and west.  To the far north you can barely make out the
ramp that you descended to get into this man-made hell.

Entrance Way
  Quickly running inside to shield you from the harsh desert winds you realize 
that you are in the Desert Prison. The Famed prison of which if anyone 
escapes will die from the desert. On either side of you, you see two fresh 
water springs that help make the prison self- sufficient in the desert. The 
nicely carved stones decorate the hall. You see the ramp proceed down to the 
prison. This was built that way to help cool the prison.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Rift to the Empire of Aiighialla
  You are wandering within the timeless, grey nothingness known as
rift-space.  You are just beginning to feel utterly lost when you notice a
speck of color in the distance.  It seems to be coming from another rift
similar to the one you came from.  Throwing away caution, you head towards
it, hoping it will lead you out of here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

An Ancient Road
  Huge trees grow alongside this ancient road, casting a great shadow over it.
The black stones of the road are worn so smooth that a little water on them 
makes them slick as ice. The wind stops blowing here, as if held back by an 
unnatural force. The road continues to the east.

The Ruins of Main Street [**> PK <**]
  The street is covered with rubble, but is wide enough that you can easily

easy prey for whatever is down there. The street continues to the north and 
south.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

help elemental focus
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Elemental Focus'.
Help Category : Enhancement.
Related Helps : Elementalist, Elemental Ward.
Last Updated  : 2018-01-15 00:48:07.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: cast 'elemental focus' [air|earth|fire|water]
Spell Number: 526

Budding Elementalists learn the ability to align themselves with one of the
elements quite early in their studies. While attuned to one of the elements,
all damage based on that element-- whether from spells or weapons-- will be
increased. It should be noted, however, that the elements are fickle, and a
mage may only be aligned to one at a time.

When casting the spell, if no element is chosen the last element invoked is
used.

Elemental Focus does not benefit from the duration wish.

Spell available only to the Elementalist Mage Subclass.

Primary Stat: Intelligence


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 4112/4633 HP  3879/5021 MP  1868/1868 mv  636tnl  
Lv 156  G 732881 | The Alabaster Road (NESW)

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

help lightning strike
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Lightning Strike'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Lightning Bolt.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-20 16:50:12.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'lightning strike' <victim>
Damage: electric
Spell Number: 232

After fireballs, the talented mage moves on to master the art of lightning.
Unlike the natural lightning used by rangers in the wilderness, the power
of a mage's lightning is drawn directly from their will.  High noble mages
have even been rumored to be able to generate as much as a bolt of
lightning from each finger of the hand used to cast the spell ...

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lv 156  G 732881 | Mudpits (EWD)

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

cave opens up into a substantial tunnel system. Most directions lead to 
smaller tunnels, while one major tunnel leads southwards. Slight echoes of 
metal on metal can be heard, while the smells of ash and soot waft through

Before the Gates (G)
  The gates to the dark elf city were recently razed and now bits of them lie 
scattered throughout this area. Splinters of fine eldar wood have been 
sprayed every which way, wrought iron lies bent and twisted, and obsidian 
stones are scattered about. As a result, walking through here is difficult.
Smoke rises from the rubble through the gates and lingers, making the air 
throughout the caves heavy. Patrols of dark elves wander back and forth 
through the deserted city streets, ensuring they will not lose the city 
proper, or what is left of it.

Northern Temple Road (1865)

Northeastern Temple Road
  This is the section of the city where the trading market once stood. The dark
elves haven't done much yet, with respect to cleaning up the mess here, so 
the marketplace is still a complete disaster. Carts lie tipped-over, and many
have been smashed or burnt beyond recognition. To the east is where the main 
fire still burns, and the heat of it is even evident from over here, although
the distance from it feels generously safe. It looks like the disaster here 
has already been picked through and anything of interest has been taken.
This is not surprising, considering the number of slaves that must have 
broken free during the battle that waged here. Any dead bodies have also been
carted off, and the rubble has been sort of pushed off to the side in places 
to create a narrow walking path.

<MAPEND>

[*Daily Blessing*] 4633/4633 HP  5021/5021 MP  1864/1868 mv  636tnl  
Lv 156  G 732881 | Northeastern Temple Road (NESW)
>>
s
Entrance to the Temple of the Night
  In order to reach the entrance to the most important building in the dark
elf city, the Temple of the Night, there is a path that heads up a cluster
of stalagmites that have grown together into a strange, gnarly pattern.
The path twists up, and up, and up, through the middle of a massive
cavern. How is it that these stalagmites grew to be so tall, and how lucky
were the dark elves to find a cavern so large? One very likely possibility
is that the dark elves used their magic to create this cavern and all that
is within it. Near the top of the mass of stalagmites, is the temple
entrance. At this point the stalagmites have somehow managed to wrap
themselves around the temple's set of double doors. It is tough to discern
exactly what is going on, because the doors are a glossy black, and the
stalagmites are also black. This setting is the stuff of nightmares. To
make things more confusing, will-o'-the-wisps dance across the scene every
so often, further impeding the ability to discern what is going on by
occluding vision with their bright flash of light. The path is made of
shiny, slippery, obsidian stones, and the temple door is flanked with
imposing statues depicting the handmaidens of the great goddess of the
dark elves. Their goddess is simply known as the Dark Lady, since invoking
her true name is said to bring with it her wrath. The handmaidens are
serpentine, with elven torsos and heads. They wear armor that has been
built from the skulls of the Dark Lady's enemies. The lower halves of
their bodies are like the bodies of snakes, and they also have dragon-like
wings on their backs. Their faces are drawn back in snarls, daring the
uninvited to open the temple door.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south (west) ]
(Hidden) (Red Aura) This dark elf soldier is riding a bull through the city.
(Red Aura) This dark elf patrol guard is scanning the streets, searching for intruders.

[*Daily Blessing*] 4633/4633 HP  5021/5021 MP  1863/1868 mv  636tnl

w

[*Daily Blessing*] 4633/4633 HP  5021/5021 MP  1863/1868 mv  636tnl  
Lv 156  G 732881 | Entrance to the Temple of the Night (NSW)
>>
Inside the Temple of the Night
  This is no normal temple. Stepping into the Temple of the Night is like
entering into a different type of reality. It is dark as night, and a
sound like whispering seems to come from every direction. Sometimes the
whispers get so close to the ears that it seems as if whatever is making
the sound is hovering right beside them. The shadowy mist that began to
make itself known at the temple entrance is even thicker in here. When it
is so thick that it is difficult to see, a strong floral scent arises,
then the mist always seems to dissipate a bit, but the smell is
overwhelming enough to cause dizziness. The floors in the temple are black
marble, and echo a loud clacking noise with each step an individual takes,
since the temple hall is so massive. Whenever the black fog clears enough
to be able to look around, it is still difficult to see, since it is so
dark. There is a faint light emitting from a source high above, however.
Upon looking upwards to investigate, it is revealed that some sort of
enchantment has been added to the temple to make it appear as if there are
tiny points of light lurking up high in the temple's rafters, like stars.
The swirls of mist move away to reveal statues that depict
gruesome-looking creatures, and other expensive adornments to the temple,
then quickly hide them again, teasing the onlooker.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]
(Golden Aura) A plant twists its way around one of the temple's pillars.

>>
Southeastern Temple Road
  The cave system that the dark elves chose to make their city in seems to be a
series of caverns containing what could almost be referred to as a forest of 
stalagmites. It is surreal, how large these stalagmites have grown. Each of 
these gigantic stalagmites has been made into a building that is tall enough 
to hold five to ten stories within its structure. This is evident because 
each story of each building contains a balcony for the dark elves to walk out
onto. Since dark elves are fond of using the power of levitation to get to 
where they need to be, these balconies aid them either in accessing the city 
streets or in returning them to the room they desire to occupy, in the least 
amount of time necessary.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east west ]

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

  You stand on a path leading to a strange village.  From here, the only
thing you can hear is the loud laughter of the villagers.  The path is
bordered by tall trees.  Looking ahead, you notice the roof of big houses
and, behind those, the steep flank of a mountain.  A small sign draws
your attention.

The contest room [**> PK <**]
  You stand in the giant contest room.  This is a room in which giants
gather once every month and fight each other for fun.  The room is bare,
save for a red circle on the ground.  That must be the place in which you
can decide to fight the competitors, if you don't fear being slaughtered.

The contest room [**> PK <**]
  You stand in the giant contest room.  This is a room in which giants
gather once every month and fight each other for fun.  The room is bare,
save for a red circle on the ground.  That must be the place in which you
can decide to fight the competitors, if you don't fear being slaughtered.

A street in the giant village

weapon and armour drawings on both houses' doors.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Lightning Strike'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Lightning Bolt.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-20 16:50:12.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'lightning strike' <victim>
Damage: electric
Spell Number: 232

After fireballs, the talented mage moves on to master the art of lightning.
Unlike the natural lightning used by rangers in the wilderness, the power
of a mage's lightning is drawn directly from their will.  High noble mages
have even been rumored to be able to generate as much as a bolt of
lightning from each finger of the hand used to cast the spell ...

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) Lilenia the Sorcerer.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Forma not formatted.

Barren Field (1847)

Crumbling Field
  This field is slowly crumbling into the rushing river to the east. As you 
watch, more and more of the unprotected shoreline ripples away into the 
thunderous water. To the northwest, a small forest broods over the fields all
around it. Somewhere eastwards, a small trail collapses into what has become 
known as Kettermoor Crick: the fishy river leading into what is known as 
Mesolar's melting pot of debauchery. One may merely cross the Kettermoor to 
enter Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west other ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3267/4633 HP  4495/5021 MP  1846/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Crumbling Field (NESW*)
>>
On the Crickbridge Road
  It was a dark and stormy night...

  There's a saying out in the darker parts of the country that, for a man
in the right kinds of trouble, all roads lead to Fellchantry. They say that
when "No Fear" Narlfryd, the famed Wolfen daredevil, needed a place to lay
low, he came to Fellchantry and knifed a guy over a card game. The story
goes that he wanted to use a vacation in a cell as a chance to let a bad
storm blow over. The authorities didn't give him the chance. They took one
look at that body, shook their heads, and walked the other way. Fellchantry
is just that kind of place. Around here, they're ALL dark and stormy nights,
and the residents like it that way just fine.

  To the east lies the bridge over Kettermoor Crick, the deceptively named
fast-running river that supplies Fellchantry with its ne'erending supply of
fish, trade taxes, and surly attitudes.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3267/4633 HP  4495/5021 MP  1845/1868 mv  421tnl

[*Daily Blessing*] 3267/4633 HP  4495/5021 MP  1845/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | On the Crickbridge Road (EW)
>>


e
The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick
    The rushing waters of Kettermoor Crick flow far below this sturdy stone
bridge. In the miserable old days, the people that first settled this
godsforsaken scar of land built the bridge to access Fellchantry-- the squat,
sprawling island that sits astride the river like the biggest bully in the
schoolyard. Or so they say anyway... Really, it'd make just as much sense if
they built the bridge to give themselves something high enough to jump from.
Fellchantry isn't what you'd call a vacation spot. The water is colder
and darker than a witch's heart. The fog-- like a mourner's veil-- stretches
perpetually over the land, as if the sun just can't eat a big enough
breakfast to ever cook it off. This is where dreams go to die.

  To the west the Crickbridge Road leads away from town. To the east the city
of Fellchantry looms, looking like the saddest verse of the most dismal dirge
you've ever heard. If the word on the street is true, then the murdered smith
is somewhere inside, his body giving off the putrescent stench of a mystery.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1868/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick (EW)
>>
e
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1867/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
Fellchantry Square
  The presence of the barony's courthouse to the north does nothing to curb
the traffic of the usual ne'er-do-wells and cutthroats here. For the majority
of the Justiciars-- Fellchantry's city guards-- the pay just isn't good
enough to really make an effort. The occasional drunk gets roughed up, and
a murderer may even be arrested if he's a little too indiscrete, but in the
end it's just keeping up appearances. Who cares about a murder when no one
misses the deceased? Besides, everyone in Fellchantry is guilty of something.

  Justice waits to the north, longing for someone to avenge the slander done
to her name. The square looms predatorily to the east and south.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1866/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
w
A Docked Ship
  The crates being loaded and unloaded from this ship suggests its purpose to 
be mercantile to some degree, and there is little doubt that it may have a 
long and rich history. The deck's planks are a variety of colors, suggesting 
dozens of replacements over the years (or perhaps decades). Up to the helm, 
one can spy the ship's wheel having been broken and repaired several times 
over as well. Above the door which leads down into the barge is an elegant 
engraving upon a wooden panel, reading the ship's name: The Golden Coin.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1865/1868 mv  421tnl

Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
w
Justiciar Headquarters
  This aged building, remarkable only in that it's slightly less run down than
the structures around it, is home to His Majesty's Justiciars. From here
Fellchantry's city guards work hard at the appearance of upholding justice.
In reality the guards are only about two steps removed from being criminals
themselves, and the sour reek of tobacco, alcohol, and sweat on the air says
much about the Justiciars' efficacy. Still, the Baron's coat of arms hangs
large on the wall, and that's all the legitimacy these men need.

  His Majesty's Kangaroo Court is in the western wing of the courthouse. To
the south wait the pickpockets and cutpurses of Fellchantry Square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south west ]
(Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.
(Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.
One of the barony's detectives lounges on a chair with his feet in the air.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1863/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Justiciar Headquarters (SW)
>>
His Majesty's Court of Justice
  A large dais at the westernmost end of a long walkway is the most prominent
feature of His Majesty's Court of Justice. On it is a simple judge's bench,
its face decorated with the Baron's coat of arms. Those wondering about the
Baron's views on justice can find their questions answered by the large
painting that totally dominates the wall behind the bench. Simply titled,
"Justice," it depicts a woman with a radiant halo and pure white vestments
holding a sword aloft with one elegantly-sandled foot atop a pile of corpses.
It's not exactly the sort of court at whose mercy one throws oneself.
Non-descript hardwood benches are arranged in two aisles so that the
populace may observe the proceedings of the court, though few ever do.

  The way back east leads to the Justiciar Headquarters, and to the bustling
city square beyond.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) A clerk rushes past with a stack of papers.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1862/1868 mv  421tnl

Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
Fellchantry Square [**> PK <**]
    The signature smell of Fellchantry (jokingly referred to as "Kettermoor
Cologne") wafts in with particular potency from the west, hinting at
the docks to be found in that direction. The aroma, not so much unpleasant
as it is unusual, has strong fishy accents punctuated with less-identifiable
effluvia. Fishmongers exhort the crowds with carny-like shouts, each
extolling the freshness and superiority of their particular wares. The
occasional prostitute wanders through, on their way to providing the
services of Andolor's oldest profession to the dock crowd.
 
  Fellchantry's docks lie to the west, offering an escape from the square.
Farther east an unusually lively building boasts signs claiming the coldest
beer in the Barony.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.

Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
[**> PK <**] >>
n
A Cramped Alleyway
  This particular alleyway - unlike many of the others in which the denizens of
Fellchantry conduct their lucrative business - finds itself oddly quiet.
Mayhaps it be that Fellchantry Square itself is the central hustle of the 
settlement, paving the way towards bars, men or women for hire and narrow 
passages offering an escape from day-to-day struggles. Mayhaps, in fact, it 
be that there is actually clean and running water trickling away to the 
north; one could surmise that the town's aversion to anything not coming out 
of a bar keeps stragglers at bay.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1858/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | A Cramped Alleyway (NS)
>>
w
The Aqueduct
  One may find themselves hard pressed to believe that Fellchantry would have 
any running water save for that of Kettermoor Crick. Nay, not for any reason 
of trade or surly attitudes but for a scent that clings to the air. The stink
of unwashed bodies and alcohol-laden belches may be quite the most telling 
when pondering the aqueduct's purpose - the conclusion anyone would come to 
is that it has none. It could be placed in the running for Andolor's cleanest
water supply if it were not for the disrepair in which the stonework finds 
itself. 
 
Eastwards and west, the aqueduct narrows and terminates within the 
bowels of high grey stone walls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1857/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Aqueduct (ESW)
>>
e
The Aqueduct
  If you were to close one eye, tilt your head a bit, and then close your other
eye, you might be able to suss out some details past the first inches of the 
hardly-opaque waters which stream underfoot from the east towards a grate in 
the western wall, eventually plummeting away into darkness. No doubt it leads
to Kettermoor Crick; a wasteful supply, at that. It doesn't smell nearly as 
bad here as it does when one enters Fellchantry's spiked maw to the 
southwest. Alas, silence itself is also quite the rare commodity among the 
ramshackle stone buildings which make up the settlement; one would not need 
to strain their ears to hear the rattling of bars and enraged yells beyond 
the cramped windows in the southern wall.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1855/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Aqueduct (E)

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1853/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Aqueduct (ESW)
>>
The Aqueduct
  On occasion the odd wilted sheaf of lettuce would drift its way from the 
small grate in the eastern wall towards the west, sailing through the 
aqueduct like a small organic mercantile ship. On another occasion, a bubble 
would be belched upwards from the shallow aqueduct underfoot to release the 
signature whiff of stale ale into the air. To the southwest the bustle and 
loud cries of mongers peddling their wares can be heard eminating from 
Fellchantry Square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1851/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Aqueduct (W)

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1846/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
[**> PK <**] >>
e
Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3308/4633 HP  4550/5021 MP  1845/1868 mv  421tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (ESW)
>>
Baron's Beerhouse
    Lauded as the place to be in Fellchantry, the ironically named "Baron's 
Beerhouse" (most likely never visited by the Baron himself, if rumor is to be
believed) houses a massive selection of tables, chairs, sounds, smells and 
people. The walls are adorned with basic decor and sconces which have long 
since been coated by wax from dripping candles, then coated again and never
cleaned. Smoke hangs in the air as thick as the noise generated by the 
milling of bodies and full-bellied laughter.

To the west, double-doors lead back out into the square.

<MAPEND>

s
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1867/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
w
w
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.
One of Fellchantry's Justiciars can be seen kneeling next to a corpse.
Magister Liam beckons for you to follow.
Magister Liam says, "Hark!  Come hither, I require aid."
Magister Liam asks, "This is Juilus Sannar, our good baron's silversmith. 
 While our justiciars sweep the square, would you deliver a message for
 me?"

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1866/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1865/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
e
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1864/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NE[S])
>>
e
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1863/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1862/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1861/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A welcome break from the square, buildings of stone and layered over with 
plaster cascade in varying shapes and forms towards the south. Beddings and 
pots provide a surprisingly lush fauna in reflection to the denizens which 
march these cobblestone ways - lords and ladies by any given right, all 
marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1860/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]S)
>>
La Rochelle Row
  A conglomerate of buildings continue to sprawl their way southwards and 
eventually come to an end at an awakward cul de sac, though the brilliant 
white of cobble beneath an eternal gloomy sky have yet to lose their luster 
within the Barony. Yonder west lies perhaps the most inconspicuous building 
of the lot - enough so that one may not place words to it lest they venture 
beyond their vocabulary. Eastwards, however, among the cries of "Ho, lad!" 
for carriageboys rests a grand manor upon evidently rich soil, its gardens 
immaculate and lacking no maintenance. 
 
Northwards La Rochelle Row continues before eventually terminating within
the infamous Fellchantry Square, where a particular entanglement of scents
may remind the denizens of this lovely place of "home".

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) (west) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1859/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (N[E][W])
>>

clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1857/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
There is no door to the east of here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1857/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2380/4633 HP  3418/5021 MP  1856/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
     (Invis) (Magic) (Enhanced) The sash of a peddler lies here.
(Red Aura) A member of the Guild walks the alleys, perusing the available wares.
(Red Aura) A petitioner of the Guild tries to peddle off some gems.
(Red Aura) Someone's hands simply cannot leave others' pockets alone, and this is one of them.
A large bouncer checks to ensure that no unscrupulous folk approach the alleys.
A large bouncer grips you by your collar and britches, tossing you out onto the cobblestones!

w
A shocked onlooker says 'Wait until me mum hears about today's events.'

Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there

w
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) ]

## Aardwolf moves into the Season of Burning. ##
You notice the black moon falling to the west.

s
La Rochelle Row
  A welcome break from the square, buildings of stone and layered over with 
plaster cascade in varying shapes and forms towards the south. Beddings and 
pots provide a surprisingly lush fauna in reflection to the denizens which 
march these cobblestone ways - lords and ladies by any given right, all 
marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1867/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]S)
>>

You open the door.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1865/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
The General Store
  What purports to be a simple general store on the outside is somehow so
much more on the inside... The shop's proprietor prides himself on having
something for everyone, and to that end the shop is a mess of shelves and
racks, each holding its own little universe of odds and ends. The General
Store is the sort of place where one enters and seems to find the very
thing they were just wishing they had. The deep shadows lining the far
corners of the shop, and the way the hushed whispers of customers suddenly
cease when anyone gets too close, are enough to show most just how sinister
the desires of the clientele can be. In Fellchantry everything is for sale,
and affording the price isn't always a matter of money.
  
  The front door leads north back to the square, but who could leave when
their heart's most cherished treasure is bound to be on the next shelf they
see? Stay a while... Stay a while...

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
An older gentleman in fine dress tends to the many curios in the shop.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1864/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The General Store (N)
>>

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1862/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A welcome break from the square, buildings of stone and layered over with 
plaster cascade in varying shapes and forms towards the south. Beddings and 
pots provide a surprisingly lush fauna in reflection to the denizens which 
march these cobblestone ways - lords and ladies by any given right, all 
marred with some deformation or another which tells of their past during (or 
perhaps prior to) their stay within Fellchantry. Surely the Barony had seen 
no opulence like this since Valkur himself had fallen.
 
To one's north they would find their gaze fixated upon the many bodies which 
traffic Fellchantry Square, while southwards the opulence continues. Many 
structures present the grace and presence of emulated royalty, though some 
find themselves distinguished from others via eye-catching entrances and bold
gatherings before their respective halls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1861/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (N[E]S)
>>
op e
e
You open the door.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1861/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (NES)
>>
Wine and Sorcery
  Tucked away behind the decadence of plastered walls and powdered silks lies a 
structure which one might have surmised would be a temple. Alas, despite the 
grand pillars, polished frescoes and vaulted ceilings the interior of this 
seemingly holy place has been adorned with varnished tables of deep oak and 
chairs reclined in cushions and teak. The air is ever-thickened and blue with
smoke, carrying naught but the melodic laughter and posh ramblings of those 
who could call themselves nobility within the Barony.
 
Placed firmly at the western exit is a single door of heavy and treated
wood, its engravings depicting many abstract concepts causing the average
set of eyes to cross if looked at too closely.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
     Tables and cushioned seats are laid out about the area.

(Golden Aura) A gentryman enjoys a drink over a platter of seafood.
(Golden Aura) A gentryman enjoys a drink over a platter of seafood.
A strapping man serves complex cocktails.
A sleazeball merchant says 'After this, I dare say you may even buy the Baron out of his home.'

Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (NES)
>>
s
La Rochelle Row
  A conglomerate of buildings continue to sprawl their way southwards and 
eventually come to an end at an awakward cul de sac, though the brilliant 
white of cobble beneath an eternal gloomy sky have yet to lose their luster 
within the Barony. Yonder west lies perhaps the most inconspicuous building 
of the lot - enough so that one may not place words to it lest they venture 
beyond their vocabulary. Eastwards, however, among the cries of "Ho, lad!" 
for carriageboys rests a grand manor upon evidently rich soil, its gardens 
immaculate and lacking no maintenance. 
 
Northwards La Rochelle Row continues before eventually terminating within
the infamous Fellchantry Square, where a particular entanglement of scents
may remind the denizens of this lovely place of "home".

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) (west) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1858/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (N[E][W])

[*Daily Blessing*] 2504/4633 HP  3669/5021 MP  1858/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (NE[W])
>>
Bell and Ball
  Much of this manor appears to be closed off for no particular purpose, though
the foyer is massive. The expansive area houses a large selection of 
embroidered carpets running along the outer edges of the room, its center a 
smooth and polished wooden dancefloor. At all times of day, dignitaries can 
be seen moving in and out, drinking their fine wines, wearing their fine 
clothes, and dancing to fine music. A chalice rests at the northwestern side 
of the room, ever-overflowing into a large basin with a smooth and 
rich-smelling liquor from which the patrons of the manor ladle into their 
goblets.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
     (Magic) An Everlasting Chalice rests in the corner of the room, spilling wine.
(Red Aura) A man in finery schmoozes with the guests.
(Red Aura) One of Fellchantry's serving girls slips between dancing couples with a platter of
beverages.
(Red Aura) A picture of elegance and grace, this woman is twirled by her dance partner.

Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (NEW)
>>
The Guild
  The working class of Fellchantry: the Guild is a simple stone building which 
one may mistake for a tavern or bar at a glance. Tables and chairs are 
littered across the area in no particular pattern. At the far western edge of
the room is a long, wide bar, the wall behind it lined with wooden shelves 
housing a large selection of liquors with no label or indication of what it 
may be, though whatever barkeep may be servicing the organization's members 
seems to know exactly what lies where, what goes into what, and which 
concoction to conjure. Upon the northern and southern walls are a scattering 
of mis-matched decor. Right next to a large tapestry is a taxidermied boar's 
head, or an emblem with crossed swords embossed upon a wooden panel would 
hang askew, teetering on the edge of harpooning the skull of whoever may find 
themselves beneath it should it eventually decide to fall.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
(Red Aura) An inconspicuous member of the Guild loiters about.
A smirking woman leans back on a simple wooden chair, cleaning her nails with a knife.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1865/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Guild (E)
