[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1863/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | La Rochelle Row (NES)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  Most of the traffic at this intersection of the square is either coming
from or going toward the south. The third most corrupt organization in the
city (after its government, and its law enforcement) has its guild hall in
that direction, and with the recent trade talks announced by the Baron there
are plenty of foreigners and citizens alike who feel the need to visit the
Merchant's Guild. Hatred and bigotry wash from Fellchantry's citizens in a
palpable wave toward the outlanders with their strange features, strange
clothing, and strange ways. Likewise in a southerly direction are the homes
of some of Fellchantry's more affluent, non-royal citizens, as well as
several other guild halls. There is even said to be an assassin's guild,
but who can afford to believe everything they hear?
   
  Affluence is to the south, along with all the dark deeds it can buy. The
press of stinking bodies in the square is all around.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1862/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.
One of Fellchantry's Justiciars can be seen kneeling next to a corpse.
Magister Liam beckons for you to follow.
Magister Liam says, "Hark!  Come hither, I require aid."
Magister Liam asks, "This is Juilus Sannar, our good baron's silversmith. 
 While our justiciars sweep the square, would you deliver a message for
 me?"

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1861/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
e
e
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1860/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel gives you a mighty kick, sending you flying away from the bridge!

Lv 156  G 698297 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
w
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1857/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
s
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]
(Red Aura) A nobleman steps carefully as not to sully his new shoes.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1856/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NES)
>>
The General Store
  What purports to be a simple general store on the outside is somehow so
much more on the inside... The shop's proprietor prides himself on having
something for everyone, and to that end the shop is a mess of shelves and
racks, each holding its own little universe of odds and ends. The General
Store is the sort of place where one enters and seems to find the very
thing they were just wishing they had. The deep shadows lining the far
corners of the shop, and the way the hushed whispers of customers suddenly
cease when anyone gets too close, are enough to show most just how sinister
the desires of the clientele can be. In Fellchantry everything is for sale,
and affording the price isn't always a matter of money.
  
  The front door leads north back to the square, but who could leave when
their heart's most cherished treasure is bound to be on the next shelf they
see? Stay a while... Stay a while...

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
An older gentleman in fine dress tends to the many curios in the shop.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1855/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The General Store (N)
>>
list
Num  Level  Price    Qty  Item
---  -----  -------  ---  -----------------------------------
  1    170  2502252  ---  a strange amulet
  2    160    78005  ---  a potent elixir
  3    160   174220  ---  a petitioner's application
  4    160   149920  ---  a silver palm pin
Quantity '---' means unlimited supply.
To see the stats of an item in the store, use 'Appraise <Item>'.

The Heart of the Mystery
  Alas, some foul tragedy seems to have occurred here, for nothing else
could so reliably draw such a diverse crowd of onlookers. Loud cries of
"Murder most foul!" and "What villainy!" abound. At the center of the
whole mess, mayhap literally as well as figuratively, stand a group of His
Majesty's Justiciars observing one very dead body. The darkness of the
deed and the storm of intrigue sure to follow are a fitting complement to
the dark and stormy nights so common in the Barony.

  Fellchantry Square stretches out in all directions, oblivious to the
fact that Death has paid a visit nearby.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The corpse of a young man lies here, surrounded by a crowd of people.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
A man in a dark brown coat inspects the corpse.
One of Fellchantry's Justiciars can be seen kneeling next to a corpse.
Magister Liam beckons for you to follow.
Magister Liam says, "Hark!  Come hither, I require aid."
Magister Liam asks, "This is Juilus Sannar, our good baron's silversmith. 
 While our justiciars sweep the square, would you deliver a message for
 me?"

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1852/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Heart of the Mystery (NESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A single gold coin.
(Red Aura) A man moves about the crowd, trying to peddle fish to shocked onlookers.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1851/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
s
s
Fellchantry Square
  A very curious amount of folks who traffic to the south have their hoods 
drawn, save the braver and more scary-looking individuals who stalk with the 
deadly (and frankly, sometimes swaying) grace of the land's most hardened 
criminals, traffickers and scorned illegitimate children ever to be produced
on Andolorian soil. It's not difficult to suss out the fact that in yonder 
direction lies a network of alleyways, nor is it difficult to determine that 
some folks are simply not welcome among the raff. Nay, quite often an unlucky
individual would find themselves pleading, hoisted by their britches and 
tossed from the narrow building flanks into the pounded cobble below, ejected
from the seedy underbelly of Fellchantry.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2549/4633 HP  3724/5021 MP  1850/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NSW)
>>
Brimtoil Alley
  The entrance to the small network of Fellchantry's alleyways seems to be more
populated than further in. Establishments, all of clean and honorable repute 
of course, have taken down walls and built doors, setting up tables or stalls
along the eastern and western side, trading in weapons, oddly valuable 
jewelry, gems, glass passed off as gems, illusions passed off as glass, and 
lies passed off as illusions. Upon close inspection, one may even spy one of 
the Justiciary among the patrons of this fine market road.

Further south, the alleyway eventually twists east and out of sight.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south ]
     (Invis) (Magic) (Enhanced) The sash of a peddler lies here.
(Red Aura) A member of the Guild walks the alleys, perusing the available wares.
(Red Aura) A petitioner of the Guild tries to peddle off some gems.
(Red Aura) Someone's hands simply cannot leave others' pockets alone, and this is one of them.
A large bouncer checks to ensure that no unscrupulous folk approach the alleys.
A large bouncer grips you by your collar and britches, tossing you out onto the cobblestones!

n
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2591/4633 HP  3807/5021 MP  1867/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
n
Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2591/4633 HP  3807/5021 MP  1866/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (ESW)

[*Daily Blessing*] 2591/4633 HP  3807/5021 MP  1865/1868 mv  431tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel gives you a mighty kick, sending you flying away from the bridge!
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the

closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties

Bridge Three
  A tale as old as time, the denizens of Fellchantry have wondered for many 
decades - perhaps centuries - why the very structure which bridges 
Fellchantry Square and the dwelling of His Lordship, Lord Whatshisface, had 
never gotten an official name. Lo, the name of this bridge is carved into the
timbers as well as the burly men who stand watch upon it; their arms are like
tree stumps and their stances that of great sentries who guard the good 
Lord's halls. Lo, they nor their impassive watch comes to a halt.
  
Lo, how snugly their britches fit.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A large, muscular man stands sentinel on the bridge.
A large sentinel guards the bridge.
The sentinel gives you a mighty kick, sending you flying away from the bridge!
Fellchantry Square
  For all Fellchantry's Square's boasting of a dense population, here the 
moving and close press of bodies is less apparent. Sparser, in fact, the 
closer one moves towards the hulking drawbridge which lies eastwards and is 
stationed with men in glimmering armor and pointy weapons of all varieties 
and levels of use. Beyond the bridge and an impressive distance into the sky 
stretches a fort, littered with arrow slits and even more pointy materials 
leveled towards the grounds below.
 
To the north, south and west, the Square continues to sprawl out and avail 
itself of the free (yet more dangerous) space offered here.

<MAPEND>

Fellchantry Square
  Here, traffic is heavy. Oft there would be two seperate rows leading to and 
fro the double doors which rest upon rusted hinges to the east, possibly 
never having been closed over decades of being pelted with rain and snow 
until lodged in place permanently. Commotion never ceases amidst merriment 
and the frequent clatter of a good old fashioned brawl among the 
establishment's patrons.
 
To the south and the west Fellchantry Square continues to sprawl out, cobbles
underfoot sodden and trampled deep beneath the earth after years of harried 
abuse.

Baron's Beerhouse
    Lauded as the place to be in Fellchantry, the ironically named "Baron's 
Beerhouse" (most likely never visited by the Baron himself, if rumor is to be
believed) houses a massive selection of tables, chairs, sounds, smells and 
people. The walls are adorned with basic decor and sconces which have long 
since been coated by wax from dripping candles, then coated again and never
cleaned. Smoke hangs in the air as thick as the noise generated by the 
milling of bodies and full-bellied laughter.

To the west, double-doors lead back out into the square.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east west ]
(Red Aura) A man in a cloak purses his lips and watches the door.
(Red Aura) (Angry) A rowdy ruffian laughs and throws another punch.
(Golden Aura) This barmaid spends more of her time flirting than serving.

Baron's Beerhouse
  A quieter corner of the beerhouse, though merely in comparison as opposed to 
fact or widely accepted truth, laughter can be heard rolling through the area
from all directions. More broody folk appear to make themselves at home here,
corner tables and chairs allowing a decent view of the area, though spaced 
apart enough for some to enjoy their drinks in relative solitude. The wall 
sconces here are caked to the brim with old wax, the idea of replenishing the
candles in this spot a long forgotten memory.

To the south one may find the beerhouse's exit.

Baron's Beerhouse
  A lofty corner, the great bar of the Baron's Beerhouse runs in a large L 
across the northern and eastern wall, eventually terminating in a small door 
which swings this way and that as bartenders move their way in and out to 
serve the establishment's patrons. Many of the more relaxed, or perhaps 
careless, folk sit here with their backs to the door at the bar's edge, 
jokingly referred to as the "maintenance team" for keeping the taps flowing 
and the kegs empty as payment. Laughter rolls through the air of the 
beerhouse, almost as if trapped in permanent festivity.

Fellchantry Square (1867)

Fellchantry Square [**> PK <**] (1866)

Fellchantry Square (1865)

Fellchantry Square (1864)

The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick (1863)

On the Crickbridge Road
  It was a dark and stormy night...

  There's a saying out in the darker parts of the country that, for a man
in the right kinds of trouble, all roads lead to Fellchantry. They say that
when "No Fear" Narlfryd, the famed Wolfen daredevil, needed a place to lay
low, he came to Fellchantry and knifed a guy over a card game. The story
goes that he wanted to use a vacation in a cell as a chance to let a bad
storm blow over. The authorities didn't give him the chance. They took one
look at that body, shook their heads, and walked the other way. Fellchantry
is just that kind of place. Around here, they're ALL dark and stormy nights,
and the residents like it that way just fine.

  To the east lies the bridge over Kettermoor Crick, the deceptively named
fast-running river that supplies Fellchantry with its ne'erending supply of
fish, trade taxes, and surly attitudes.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3920/4633 HP  4374/5021 MP  1862/1868 mv  427tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | On the Crickbridge Road (EW)
>>
e
The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick
    The rushing waters of Kettermoor Crick flow far below this sturdy stone
bridge. In the miserable old days, the people that first settled this
godsforsaken scar of land built the bridge to access Fellchantry-- the squat,
sprawling island that sits astride the river like the biggest bully in the
schoolyard. Or so they say anyway... Really, it'd make just as much sense if
they built the bridge to give themselves something high enough to jump from.
Fellchantry isn't what you'd call a vacation spot. The water is colder
and darker than a witch's heart. The fog-- like a mourner's veil-- stretches
perpetually over the land, as if the sun just can't eat a big enough
breakfast to ever cook it off. This is where dreams go to die.

  To the west the Crickbridge Road leads away from town. To the east the city
of Fellchantry looms, looking like the saddest verse of the most dismal dirge
you've ever heard. If the word on the street is true, then the murdered smith
is somewhere inside, his body giving off the putrescent stench of a mystery.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A man in a guard's uniform walks here, no doubt a justiciary.
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3920/4633 HP  4374/5021 MP  1862/1868 mv  427tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick (EW)
>>

The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick

[*Daily Blessing*] 3975/4633 HP  4475/5021 MP  1867/1868 mv  427tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | The Bridge Over Kettermoor Crick (EW)
>>
e
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Golden Aura) An in-love couple looks at the scene with curiosity.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3975/4633 HP  4475/5021 MP  1866/1868 mv  427tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>

Ospario chants the phrase 'cisotates'.
Ospario's feet rise off the ground.

A curious couple leaves north.

s
Fellchantry Square
  The southwestern portion of Fellchantry Square is most notable for being
the location of the city's shopping district, such as it is. Small
mercantile shops abound, each with signs boasting their wares. The largest
of the shops, the general store, boasts a sign reading: "Needful Things
For Sale or Trade." From the flow of traffic in and out of the shop, its
Things must be very Needful indeed.

  To the south marvelous things are for sale. To the north and east
the square offers other amusements.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3975/4633 HP  4475/5021 MP  1865/1868 mv  427tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NES)

n
n
Fellchantry Square
  Here, filled with all manner of sights and smells, is Fellchantry Square.
In the constant hell of the Barony, this is where the honest (and you have
to be flexible on your definition here) citizens come to gossip, barter, and
conduct their necessary business. The square is a microcosm of the city; all
cramped buildings, bustling crowds, and narrow side streets. A guy could get
lost with the slightest wandering from the beaten path, and he probably
wouldn't like where he ended up. The only thing less welcoming than
Fellchantry's main streets are its back alleys.
 
  The spikes of the raised Kettermoor gate loom to the west like a dragon
waiting for a snack. From all other directions the cramped chaos of the
square presses in.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) A well-dressed spectator is here, making a fuss.
(Golden Aura) A young man stares ahead, wide-eyed.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3975/4633 HP  4475/5021 MP  1864/1868 mv  427tnl  
Lv 156  G 698297 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>
Fellchantry Square
  The presence of the barony's courthouse to the north does nothing to curb
the traffic of the usual ne'er-do-wells and cutthroats here. For the majority
of the Justiciars-- Fellchantry's city guards-- the pay just isn't good
enough to really make an effort. The occasional drunk gets roughed up, and
a murderer may even be arrested if he's a little too indiscrete, but in the
end it's just keeping up appearances. Who cares about a murder when no one
misses the deceased? Besides, everyone in Fellchantry is guilty of something.

  Justice waits to the north, longing for someone to avenge the slander done
to her name. The square looms predatorily to the east and south.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

help lightning strike
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Lightning Strike'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Lightning Bolt.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-20 16:50:12.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'lightning strike' <victim>
Damage: electric
Spell Number: 232

After fireballs, the talented mage moves on to master the art of lightning.
Unlike the natural lightning used by rangers in the wilderness, the power
of a mage's lightning is drawn directly from their will.  High noble mages
have even been rumored to be able to generate as much as a bolt of
lightning from each finger of the hand used to cast the spell ...

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3496/4633 HP  4294/5021 MP  1868/1868 mv  356tnl  
Lv 156  G 702634 | Fellchantry Square (NESW)
>>


help elemental focus
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Elemental Focus'.
Help Category : Enhancement.
Related Helps : Elementalist, Elemental Ward.
Last Updated  : 2018-01-15 00:48:07.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: cast 'elemental focus' [air|earth|fire|water]
Spell Number: 526

Budding Elementalists learn the ability to align themselves with one of the
elements quite early in their studies. While attuned to one of the elements,
all damage based on that element-- whether from spells or weapons-- will be
increased. It should be noted, however, that the elements are fickle, and a
mage may only be aligned to one at a time.

When casting the spell, if no element is chosen the last element invoked is
used.

Elemental Focus does not benefit from the duration wish.

Spell available only to the Elementalist Mage Subclass.

Primary Stat: Intelligence


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

game.)

adventurers.

Lair of Prince Azhirlur

hanging on the dreary stone wall.  Even more peculiar are the figurines of
gold and the bowls of fine china that sit on the primitive table in the
center of the room.  It is an obvious contrast to the other dark and gloomy
rooms you have come across in this stronghold.  The tenant of this lair is
undeniably one who is unusually fascinated by the items that have been
seized from his victims.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Turbulent Sea
  There is an abrupt change in the placid ocean waters.  The skies have
blackened and it seems that there is dark, corrupt magic causing the waves
to crash and churn violently against you.  A helpless feeling overwhelms you
as you find yourself being pulled down into the inky depths below you.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3626/4633 HP  4728/5021 MP  1868/1868 mv  337tnl  
Lv 156  G 705273 | Alcove below Stronghold of Tumek (NESWU)
[**> PK <**] >>
Crudely Carved Passage
  It is pitch black, and you wait a moment for your eyes to adjust so you
can get your bearings.  You soon realize that you are in the middle of some
sort of Sahuagin stronghold.  The passage you stand in leads off in various
directions.  The faint shrieks of pain and death coming from beyond the stone
walls send tremors of apprehension through your body.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south down ]

Dim Stronghold Passage
  You continue deeper into the stronghold and find it necessary to duck
behind a niche from time to time to hide.  Females and guards are just some
of the Sahuagin that pass by completely unaware of your presence.

w
Shark-filled Passage
  Bloodthirsty sharks besiege you from all sides of this dark hallway. 
Bones of unfortunate victims lay scattered on the rocky floor.  The sound of
voices catches your attention to the south.  Your curiosity urges you to
head in that direction, but you will have to overcome the shark horde first.

e
Council Chamber of the Prince
  This dim chamber is similar to the others you have wandered through, only
that it is larger in size.  Hard, stone chairs, that look as if they were
chiseled from blocks of stone, are scattered throughout the room.  What
looks to be a map of some sorts is scrawled on one of the walls.  

<MAPEND>

(Red Aura) This female sahuagin spends her time with the young.
(Red Aura) This female sahuagin spends her time with the young.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3626/4633 HP  4728/5021 MP  1852/1868 mv  337tnl  
Lv 156  G 705273 | Council Chamber of the Prince (NE)
>>
Lair of Prince Tumek
  You have come face to face with the formidable figure of one of the
Sahuagin princes.  He is surrounded by several guards and more of the same
sharks that you fought in the alcove.  It is not luxurious quarters that
this prince resides in.  The walls are more of the rough, cold dark stone
that makes up the rest of the stronghold.  They glow softly with a
bioluminescence that is emitted from small sea bacteria.  Behind him hangs a
skull of shark, with his large jaws open as if the long dead animal is
reaching to devour you.  On one side of the room is a carved, stone table. 
Some bloodied, barbaric daggers lay alongside a bowl that looks to be filled
with body parts of unfortunate prisoners.  A rack of tridents and spears
hangs on the wall on the one side of him.  You send a quick prayer to your
deity as you prepare to meet this foe who is now staring coldly at you.  

<MAPEND>

>>
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3122/4633 HP  4354/5021 MP  1868/1868 mv  243tnl  
Lv 156  G 708271 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Road before the small village (G)
  The woods finally clear as you approach a small village surrounded by a
small wall and with only a few buildings present. The hot sun beats down on
you as you see a desert far to the east. This appears to be the last stop
before the desert.  It might be a good idea to stock up on supplies before
traveling any further.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
     A short stone wall stands here, making a boundary.
(White Aura) A little old man is sitting on the stone wall here.
An old man says, "Welcome to the land of the Desert Prison, KumoGami! 
 Tales say that if you enter, you will never leave alive!  Whether these
 stories are true, I know not."

The old man sighs and shifts to an almost comfortable position.

An old man asks, "We're looking for a new superintendent.  Are you
 interested?"

He looks at you expectantly.

Entrance Way
  Quickly running inside to shield you from the harsh desert winds you realize 
that you are in the Desert Prison. The Famed prison of which if anyone 
escapes will die from the desert. On either side of you, you see two fresh 
water springs that help make the prison self- sufficient in the desert. The 
nicely carved stones decorate the hall. You see the ramp proceed down to the 
prison. This was built that way to help cool the prison.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3056/4633 HP  4026/5021 MP  1868/1868 mv  188tnl  
Lv 156  G 704624 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Heading west from Dak'tai [**> PK <**] (1833)

Approaching the Camp of the Gathering Horde
  Going down the hill, you can see the expansive plains of Hathzor spread out 
limitless before you, only broken by the harsh mountains to the north and the
Great Desert to the south-east. Sarcoph's warcamp dominates your view, a 
smoking black sore, a loud and bustling abomination choking the land's 
beauty. Trees logged from the local mountains have been shaved to form a gory
fence circling the encampment, ogre heads impaled intermittently on the 
saplings.

<MAPEND>

Behind the Gates
  You shudder as you pass the garish display of dominance, send up a silent 
prayer that you don't share that end. You wonder what drives the people that 
can do such things, those that can take life and torture without the 
softspoken but convincing pangs of guilt. Alas, today is not a day for 
philosophy, there are more pressing matters.

At a Tent Unparalleled in Size (G)
  You have finally reached the end of the camp, but instead of relief for the 
end of an unbearably long walk, all you can feel is awe. Awe, because to the 
east lies a tent that is impossibly large. No amount of physical coordination
could equal that required to construct it. From within come the sounds of 
explosions and shouts, and you wonder what is inside.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) (east) south ]
(Invis) As it flits speedily over your head, you catch a phrase of common tongue in the bird's song.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) Tears have marked their path down the face of this grubby, sobbing little
gnome.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3107/4633 HP  4073/5021 MP  1833/1868 mv  188tnl

The disgruntled gnome exclaims, "Move quickly, and don't tell anyone I let

Entrance to the Gnomish Siege Factory (G)
  If the resonating din outside the tent didn't prepare you for the sheer chaos
inside, that's not surprising. Smoke and steam cloud the air, piercing 
whistles shred your mind with their wails, unidentifiable objects fly through
the air, and fires erupt from the strangest places. The magnitude of this 
tent is absurd, and though you don't know who could have set it up, you know 
you don't want to be under it if it falls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south (west) ]
A line of flaming oil spreads discord sluggishly across the factory floor.
(White Aura) A realistic looking gnome made entirely of wood and metal guards the door.

The Center Aisle of the Siege Factory [**> PK <**] (1833)

Finished Engines
  The finished products are stored here, but the volume of completed war 
machines doesn't add up to the level of production this factory is capable 
of. They must be put into use quickly. At least there aren't many here to 
deal with. Or it could be fun to give one of these things a try while no one 
has time to stop you.

The Center Aisle of the Siege Factory [**> PK <**]
  Moving down the center of the tent only serves to immerse you further in the 
cacophony. You consider leaning against one of the many large, wooden support
beams but decide the potential respite not worth the risk. Seeking the silver
lining, you find that you have a clearer view of all the wacky proceedings 
from this vantage point.

The Supervisor's Office [**> PK <**]
  This is the office of the poor soul assigned to overseeing the gnomes' 
progress. A poorly constructed desk sits charred and abandoned against the 
wall of the tent, looking forlorn and well beyond its prime. An uncomfortable
looking chair, overturned in the middle of the room, looks a fitting partner 
for the abused desk. You decide to search for the luckless chap in charge.

Entrance to the Gnomish Siege Factory (G)
  If the resonating din outside the tent didn't prepare you for the sheer chaos
inside, that's not surprising. Smoke and steam cloud the air, piercing 
whistles shred your mind with their wails, unidentifiable objects fly through
the air, and fires erupt from the strangest places. The magnitude of this 
tent is absurd, and though you don't know who could have set it up, you know 
you don't want to be under it if it falls.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south (west) ]
(Red Aura) The bolt launched from a half-finished ballista falls laughably short of your person.
A line of flaming oil spreads discord sluggishly across the factory floor.
(White Aura) A realistic looking gnome made entirely of wood and metal guards the door.

At a Tent Unparalleled in Size (G)
  You have finally reached the end of the camp, but instead of relief for the 
end of an unbearably long walk, all you can feel is awe. Awe, because to the 
east lies a tent that is impossibly large. No amount of physical coordination
could equal that required to construct it. From within come the sounds of 
explosions and shouts, and you wonder what is inside.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

help mafia
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Mafia Mchat.
Help Category : Features.
Related Helps : Mafia-commands, Mafia-options, Mafia-roles, Mafia-tips.
Last Updated  : 2011-11-22 21:39:03.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: mafia <subcommand> [options]  : Performs mafia commands (see below)
        mchat <message>               : Individual game's chat channel.
        mafiainfo                     : Global mafia chat channel.

Mafia is a game which pits an uninformed majority (the citizens/innocents) 
against an informed minority (the mafia). In Aardwolf, Mafia games can be 
hosted by a player for other players. 

Mafia Helps & Information

For game options, see 'help mafia-options'.

For game commands, see 'help mafia-commands'.

For a list of roles, see 'help mafia-roles'.

For tips, strategies, and rules, see 'help mafia-tips'.


Gameplay

The game begins with the Mafia phase, when the Mafia (and optionally the
Vigilante) perform their kill(s). After the Mafia have acted, the night
transitions to the police/doctor phase. When the police and doctor have
used their abilities, the morning comes and any deaths are announced.
There is some time for discussion, and then all players may nominate each 
other for lynching. Each player seconded may defend himself, and then all 
players vote on each lynch candidate. A majority is required to kill; note 
that this refers to the majority of players in the game, not the majority 
of players who voted.

The game ends when one side eliminates (or nearly eliminates) the other(s).


If you have any questions, please feel free to post a note to Imm on the 
Personal board -- hope you enjoy Mafia!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3462/4669 HP  5063/5063 MP  1887/1887 mv  971tnl  
Lv 157  G 720989 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)

help camp
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Camp'.
Help Category : Survival.
Related Helps : Fire, Fast Healing, Regeneration.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-12 12:23:41.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: camp

Drawing upon their experiences of survival in the wild reaches of
Aardwolf, a skilled character can put together a makeshift shelter from
the materials around them, thus promoting a faster healing rate.
Combined with a fire, it gives all the comforts of home.  The campfire
and tent are temporary, and will fade away after a time.

Primary stat: Constitution.
Affected by : Wisdom.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3819/4669 HP  5063/5063 MP  1887/1887 mv  971tnl  
Lv 157  G 720989 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)

help locate animal
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Locate Animal'.
Help Category : Detection.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-27 23:34:24.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'locate animal' <mob keyword>
Spell Number: 151

Rangers have special abilities to locate creatures within the realm in the
same way that mages can locate objects.  The first 100 mobs with the given
keyword will be listed with their current room location.  This spell is so
powerful that it will detect creatures covered under the veil of sneak and
invisibility.  It is not powerful enough, however, to find other player
characters.

Primary Stat: None.
Affected by : None.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3936/4669 HP  5048/5063 MP  1887/1887 mv  971tnl  
Lv 157  G 720989 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)

help second attack
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Second Attack'.
Help Category : Attack Skill.
Related Helps : Third attack, Fourth attack, Fifth Attack.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-27 20:01:46.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This skill is automatic.

Training in second attack allows the character a chance at additional strikes
in combat.  100% second attack skill does NOT guarantee 2 attacks every
round, however- only the opportunity for a second strike.

Primary stat: Dexterity
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3991/4669 HP  5063/5063 MP  1887/1887 mv  971tnl  
Lv 157  G 720989 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)
>>


help summon
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : SUMMON.
Help Category : Transport.
Related Helps : Gate, Nexus, Nosummon, Portal, Vortex.
Last Updated  : 2017-09-01 10:29:41.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast summon <character>
Spell Number: 77

This spell summons a player from anywhere else in the world into your
room. Characters who are fighting may not be summoned.  You also cannot 
summon while on a quest or campaign.

By default, you are not summonable.  You must type 'nosummon' to toggle the
ability to be summoned.  Once summoned, you will again be immune to summon,
until you type 'nosummon' yet again.  To disable this safety feature, type
'autonosummon'.

The spell only works on other players.  Mobs can not be summoned.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 4022/4669 HP  5063/5063 MP  1887/1887 mv  971tnl  
Lv 157  G 720989 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)
>>

A filthy seagull flies in from the south.

A harried servant leaves south.

A harried servant arrives from the north.

Double experience for 10 minutes courtesy of Myrddin's daily blessing.

help chaos portal
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Chaos Portal'.
Help Category : Transport.
Related Helps : Chaos Portal Types, Doorway, Gate, Nexus, Portal, Wayfind.
Last Updated  : 2019-08-06 21:38:12.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'chaos portal' <ingredient> (continent)     (See below.)
Spell Number: 334

In ancient times when the world was far less stable and the Demonlord
would often descend upon the cities of Aardwolf, an emergency escape plan
was developed. This involved the creation of portals that could be handed
out to the fleeing citizens of Aardwolf. Each portal would take its owner
to a completely random location. While many had considerable misfortune in
their destinations and were slain anyway, many others survived. The
spreading of victims across the realm made it impossible for the Demonlord
to slaughter everyone so at least some survived....

Casting this spell on a blank ingredient will activate the portal and set
a destination.  The type and destination of this portal vary depending
upon the ingredient; see 'help chaos portal types' for an explanation, as
well as information on the 'continent' argument available to Navigators.

Primary stat: Wisdom.
Affected by : Intelligence, Luck.

If an existing chaos portal goes nowhere (due to an area being removed),
see 'help portal replacements' for rules for replacing it.

Blank Chaos Portals can be purchased from Ravi for trivia points, may be
daily blessing reward, or may be purchased from other players.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

CLAN: At-ten-tion! KumoGami is here to get some training done!
Inside the Great Gates
  You have passed through the great polished bronze gates of Reme, into a
city that is as splendid as the legends say.  Great domes crown the
buildings of white marble, and silver mouldings show scenes from legends
along the tops of walls all over the city.  It indeed must be a blinding
sight during sunrise and sunset.  You can see roads running to your north
and south, and some sort of large marketplace seems to be to your east.  

<MAPEND>

Entrance to the Bazaar (G)
  Smells overpower you, strange incenses that burn in oddly twisted pots,
exotic fruits from lands that no human has seen dried and hung from wooden
poles.  Voices speak in a thousand tongues, harsh northern speech conflicted
with soft eastern syllables in a cascade of noise that threatens your
composure and sanity.  The crowd that gawks in every booth and at every
wonder adds its own special noises and smells to this wonderful chaos, that
is the Bazaar at Reme.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A merchant gawks at mighty Reme.

[*Daily Blessing*] 4380/4669 HP  5063/5063 MP  1887/1887 mv  971tnl

e
The Square of the Bazaar
  Your head is definitely hurting now from the noise of the massive crowd
around you.  Women, men and children barter at every tent and table for
every imaginable item in the chaos that is the great Reman Bazaar.  Stalls
line every inch of square, with brightly coloured tents taking up the space
along the edges.  Storekeepers wander by dressed in exotic silks and linens,
while nobles and commoners alike wander by in awe.  Welcome to the square of
the Bazaar.  

<MAPEND>

Octavian Road
  This road is made of a white marble, and is kept scrupulously clean. 
Statues of a single man sit in niches along the roadway, and small offerings
lay at the feet of each one.  Clearly then this road has been named for
someone very important.

>>
Octavian Square
  This white square is composed of thousands of slabs of the purest marble,
laid cunningly end to end.  In the centre, a pedestal rises from the marbled
ground, with carvings of palm leaves and olive branches decorating the
sides.  From this pedestal a tall white statue rises, of a man in his
middle years with a regal bearing.  His cold stare tells that well the
sculptor his passions read, as he stares beyond the walls of Reme.  A small
plaque at the statue's feet reads simply 'Emperor Octavian.'  Roadways lead
from here in all directions.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

e
Astra Road
  This section of white marble roadway leads into the various guilds of the
city.  You see symbols for armor makers, sword makers, astrologers and
alchemists.  You also see the musical symbol on the building to the south of
you that would indicate the guild hall of the Bards.  To your east the road
continues into the guild district.

Octavian Road
  This is the rich part of town here in Reme. Tall columns line the street and 
marble drinking troughs sit by the side of the road for the horses that pull 
the gilded chariots. Even the servants in this section wear clothes that 
would cost you a year's looting to be able to afford. Octavian road continues
to your north and to the south you can see the South gate of Reme.

Palace Entrance (G) (1874)

Palace Gardens
  You push through green shrouded pillars, into a garden such as Kublai
Khan might have enjoyed.  Plants stream downwards like a living waterfall
across the smooth marbled textures of the wall.  Small carved fountains hold
exotic water plants, while magical songbirds dance and sing in streams of
fire in the air.  Truly a magical garden in a magical city.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Astra Road (1838)

Astra Road
  You walk along the east/west running Astra road, admiring the various
guilds of Reme.  This section appears to house the guilds of Warriors and
Mages, at least this is what the signs seem to indicate.  To your north a
painted sword and shield hang from a wooden post, and to your south a
glowing symbol of an open hand floats mysteriously in mid air.  Astra road
continues to the west and east.

A Dank Sewer Tunnel (1886)

A Dank Sewer Tunnel (1885)

   Taarn looks up at you with a feverish look in his eyes.
 He tries to rise, but his broken leg gives out and he cries out in pain.
 Taarn says 'Please... you MUST help Felisluna... Rok has her and he has lost
 whatever sanity and morals he once possessed!  You MUST find her!'
 
 Taarn motions north with his hand.
 
 He says 'She is somewhere out there... in the sewers... his headquarters is hidden
 somewhere out there.  Please... you are her only chance now that my leg has fallen
 victim to his trap... Please go help her.'

The Grand Sewer (1883)

The Grand Sewer (1882)

The Grand Sewer (1881)

An ancient tunnel (G)
  This small tunnel, carved into the walls of the great sewer, seems to
have once housed quarters and storerooms for the maintenence staff that kept
the waters flowing smoothly out from the city's heart.  Rusted iron brackets
still hold long dimmed magic lanterns that still yet hold a faint spark of
light in this impossible gloom.  A rotted wooden door sits barely closed to
your south.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (south) ]

An abandoned storeroom
  This ancient storeroom is filled with rotting supplies and tools.  Water
drips from a cracked stone ceiling onto piles of rusty picks and shovels
piled loosely in one corner.  Scurrying noises tell you that small animals
have in time infested the rotted piles of rough woven cloth sacks laying
loosely in one corner, and one shelf to the south seems to be the only thing
intact.  Indeed the shelf looks like it is almost new, strange given the age
and neglect of this forgotten room.  

<MAPEND>

A Roughly Carved Passage (1878)

Antechamber
  This hallway extends from north to south, and seems to have been carved
from the Reman stone very roughly, almost as if some magical beast tore its
way through the rock like a berserk mole.  A door is set into the west wall,
with a strange emblem seeming to be of a bloodstained mandolin?  The hallway
continues north and south.  

<MAPEND>

Rok's Office (1876)

Rok's Workshop (G)
  This room is filled with insane instruments, measuring things that only
Rok understands.  In one corner of the cluttered bench he appears to be
trying to combine a chicken and a cow...  For what fiendish reason, you
cannot imagine.  In the other side of the workshop he has a small table with
cluttered writings...  All of which are crazed rambling sonnets and poems. 
You had best leave this place as soon as possible.  

<MAPEND>

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

shelp smile

Social output for smile.
<1> - You smile happily.
<2> - <player> smiles happily.
<3> - You smile at <target>.
<4> - <player> beams a smile at <target>.
<5> - <player> smiles at you.
<6> - You smile at yourself.
<7> - <player> smiles at <him/her/them>self.
Usage this reboot : 7172 37520 (player/mob)
Created by        : Ivar

Line numbers correspond to those listed in 'HELP NEW SOCIAL'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

An Ancient Road
  Huge trees grow alongside this ancient road, casting a great shadow over it.
The black stones of the road are worn so smooth that a little water on them 
makes them slick as ice. The wind stops blowing here, as if held back by an 
unnatural force. The road continues to the east.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

An Ancient Road
  Huge trees grow alongside this ancient road, casting a great shadow over it.
The black stones of the road are worn so smooth that a little water on them 
makes them slick as ice. The wind stops blowing here, as if held back by an 
unnatural force. The road continues to the east.

<MAPEND>

Before the Dark Castle
  You are standing before a huge castle. The black stones of the walls appear 
to be larger pieces of the stone used to build the road, as they have the 
same evil feeling. The gates are closed, but unlocked. It seems that whoever 
lives here doesn't mind visitors.

Entrance of the Dark Castle [**> PK <**]
  Standing in the entryway of the Dark Castle, there do not appear to be any 
comforts. The stark stone walls rise high into the air, where a large 
chandelier hangs above you. The candles on the chandelier are unlit, 
preventing even the hint of light in the castle. Cold air blows down the long
hallway to the north, and the gates to the castle are to the east.

The Alabaster Road
  This road is made completely of perfectly placed, white stone. Several 
evergreen trees grow alongside the south side of the road, shading you from 
the sun year round. A tall, white wall follows the road along the northern 
side. It appears too high to climb, and there are no holes in the wall to 
climb through. Perhaps a gate is nearby. The road continues to the east and 
west.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Lobby of the Bonded Guildbase (G)
  For what is essentially a waiting room, this one really isn't too bad. 
It's clean, with torches casting a soft light easy on the eyes.  The wooden
walls have been painted a blue any sky would be proud to wear, so nice and
soothing.  A few tiny trees in ebony tubs occupy the corners, while
individual cushioned chairs are provided for visitors to rest after their
long journey to the Bonded Guild.  Books stand neatly on glass-topped
endtables to entertain as well.  Over it all presides a pretty receptionist
who always manages to remain polite but firm.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (north) east (south) (west) ]

 tour the Bonded Guild and wander the grounds as you like."

A Short Hallway
  The hallway is rather quiet, without a soul to be seen here.  It's large
enough that three people can walk through it abreast, a torch sconce on the
walls every ten feet or so.  It's more plain than the lobby, the wooden
walls unpainted.  A thin dirt-brown carpet does line the floor in
consideration of weary, aching feet.

The Training Field (1852)

The Training Field (1851)

A Path of Packed Dirt (1850)

The Lea (1849)

The Lea
  The Lea is several acres of lush grassland, expanding over gently rolling
hills.  Several groves of fruit trees break up the horizon, and each breeze
leaves a delicious aroma lingering on the air.  The Guildmembers' involved
with pegasi live here with their partners, their green and brown tents
blending in to the surroundings.  A wide but deliciously clear and cold
stream burbles its way eastish, and a few tasteful bridges allow passage
over it.  To the south can be glimpsed a large wooden shelter provided for
truly inclement weather.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A senior Bonded student spit-shines his partner's hooves.

run 3n2w;o s;run 3s;o e;e
The Lea (1904)

A Path of Packed Dirt (1903)

The Training Field (1902)

The Training Field (1901)

The Training Field
  The training field is huge, covering several acres.  This was, perhaps,
optimism on the part of the first Guild, who built the base.  The air
is filled with pegasi, dragons, and their human counterparts, perfecting the
skills they're going to need in the upcoming war.  The ground has long since
been packed hard from centuries of traffic by hooves and feet, and the only
grass that grows is at the very edges of the field.  A sheer cliff forms the
western and southern borders, though forest can be glimpsed to the
Southeast, and wooden buildings such as the one just south of here have been
built into tunnels in the semi-surrounding mountain.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) ]
(Golden Aura) A chubby blue dragon gives you a mournful look.
(Golden Aura) A pegasus puts its students through their paces.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A student nudges her pegasus partner back into precise formation.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2600/4698 HP  2173/5105 MP  1900/1905 mv  827tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 767741 | The Training Field (NE[S])
>>
You open the door.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2600/4698 HP  2173/5105 MP  1900/1905 mv  827tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 767741 | The Training Field (NES)
>>
A Long Hallway (1899)

A Long Hallway (1899)

A Long Hallway
  This is a rather cheerful hallway- the wooden walls are painted in sunny
yellow with purple doors.  Every inch of the floor is covered by a bright,
electric green carpet.  Don't blame the senior members of the Guild- the
students vote on the color scheme every year.  Bulletin boards in between
the doors are tacked with schedules and artwork and notices, and every
afternoon after classes, the pupils police the corridor so that it's fresh
for the next day's studies.  The schedule is fairly easy- three hours of
classes in the morning, two in the afternoon.  Of course, plenty of the
other hours are taken up by the hated drills in the training field.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north (east) south (west) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2600/4698 HP  2173/5105 MP  1899/1905 mv  827tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 767741 | A Long Hallway (N[E]S[W])
>>
You open the door.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2600/4698 HP  2173/5105 MP  1899/1905 mv  827tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 767741 | A Long Hallway (NES[W])
>>
A Classroom
  Compared to the hallway outside, this classroom is fairly boring.  The
wood of the walls is painted off-white, and the floor is bare stone, roughly
flaked into shape.  Of course, this is all done on purpose- when the room is
boring, those being taught inevitably concentrate on their teacher.  The
instructor utilizes a large easel with huge sheets of paper for
demonstrations, and the students often have to lean forward in their
uncomfortable chairs to get every detail.  On the other hand, there's only a
handful of pupils here, and each gets intense individual attention from the
teacher, resulting in superior performance and results.  It's a tried and
true method that's been working just fine for centuries, and nobody sees a
reason to change it any time soon.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west ]
(Golden Aura) A junior Bonded student rests her head against her partner.
(Golden Aura) A junior Bonded student doodles, drawing dozens of pegasi.
(Golden Aura) A junior Bonded student rests her head against her partner.
(Golden Aura) A junior Bonded student doodles, drawing dozens of pegasi.

Lv 158  G 767741 | A Long Hallway (N[E]S[W])
>>
A Storage Room
  Basic supplies are kept here, each assigned to its own spot.  The more
dangerous materials are stored in a locked cabinet to which only the
instructors and the Guildmistress have a key (as far as anybody knows
*cough*).  Cleaning supplies, paper and writing utensils, the porous sand
used whenever anybody gets sick in class- all are readily available on
wooden racks.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (west) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2644/4698 HP  2254/5105 MP  1905/1905 mv  827tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 767741 | A Long Hallway (N[E][W])
>>
The Library
  This is one of the most cherished rooms in the entire Guildbase. 
Hundreds of years' worth of documentation, literature, and treatises are
stored here, as well as the theses compiled by the senior students to
guarantee graduation.  Literally thousands of books have found a home here,
and each is treasured and treated with the utmost care.  The first time a
student is careless with something borrowed from the library will be the
last- being assigned to the cleanup crew that occasionally tries to clear
the streets of the Underground will guarantee that.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (west) ]
     (Hum) A book called "Valkur: Fact or Fiction?" glows with an eerie red light.
     (Hum) A book called "Training Your Pet Fish" leans against a bookend.
     (Hum) Volume IV of "The History of the Guild" has been left lying open.

>>
A Classroom
  Compared to the hallway outside, this classroom is fairly boring.  The
wood of the walls is painted off-white, and the floor is bare stone, roughly
flaked into shape.  Of course, this is all done on purpose- when the room is
boring, those being taught inevitably concentrate on their teacher.  The
instructor utilizes a large easel with huge sheets of paper for
demonstrations, and the students often have to lean forward in their
uncomfortable chairs to get every detail.  On the other hand, there's only a
handful of pupils here, and each gets intense individual attention from the
teacher, resulting in superior performance and results.  It's a tried and
true method that's been working just fine for centuries, and nobody sees a
reason to change it any time soon.  

<MAPEND>

for the next day's studies.  The schedule is fairly easy- three hours of
classes in the morning, two in the afternoon.  Of course, plenty of the
other hours are taken up by the hated drills in the training field.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south (west) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2644/4698 HP  2254/5105 MP  1905/1905 mv  827tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 767741 | A Long Hallway (NES[W])
>>
A Classroom
  Compared to the hallway outside, this classroom is fairly boring.  The
wood of the walls is painted off-white, and the floor is bare stone, roughly
flaked into shape.  Of course, this is all done on purpose- when the room is
boring, those being taught inevitably concentrate on their teacher.  The
instructor utilizes a large easel with huge sheets of paper for
demonstrations, and the students often have to lean forward in their
uncomfortable chairs to get every detail.  On the other hand, there's only a
handful of pupils here, and each gets intense individual attention from the
teacher, resulting in superior performance and results.  It's a tried and
true method that's been working just fine for centuries, and nobody sees a
reason to change it any time soon.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: (east) ]
(Golden Aura) A fledgling dragon nibbles at a yellow scale to leave it perfectly round.
(Golden Aura) A junior Bonded student balances a wobbly pile of study books.
(Golden Aura) A junior Bonded student quietly gathers a supply of spitwads.
(Golden Aura) A green fledgling fidgets and squirms, wanting to get outside.
(Golden Aura) A young brown dragon yawns, sure that it already knows more than the instructor.
(Golden Aura) A junior Bonded student balances a wobbly pile of study books.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2644/4698 HP  2254/5105 MP  1905/1905 mv  827tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 767741 | A Classroom (E)
>>
w
A Long Hallway
  This is a rather cheerful hallway- the wooden walls are painted in sunny
yellow with purple doors.  Every inch of the floor is covered by a bright,
electric green carpet.  Don't blame the senior members of the Guild- the
students vote on the color scheme every year.  Bulletin boards in between
the doors are tacked with schedules and artwork and notices, and every
afternoon after classes, the pupils police the corridor so that it's fresh
for the next day's studies.  The schedule is fairly easy- three hours of
classes in the morning, two in the afternoon.  Of course, plenty of the
other hours are taken up by the hated drills in the training field.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

A Long Hallway
  This is a rather cheerful hallway- the wooden walls are painted in sunny
yellow with purple doors.  Every inch of the floor is covered by a bright,
electric green carpet.  Don't blame the senior members of the Guild- the
students vote on the color scheme every year.  Bulletin boards in between

afternoon after classes, the pupils police the corridor so that it's fresh
for the next day's studies.  The schedule is fairly easy- three hours of
classes in the morning, two in the afternoon.  Of course, plenty of the

>>
A Classroom
  Compared to the hallway outside, this classroom is fairly boring.  The
wood of the walls is painted off-white, and the floor is bare stone, roughly
flaked into shape.  Of course, this is all done on purpose- when the room is
boring, those being taught inevitably concentrate on their teacher.  The
instructor utilizes a large easel with huge sheets of paper for
demonstrations, and the students often have to lean forward in their
uncomfortable chairs to get every detail.  On the other hand, there's only a
handful of pupils here, and each gets intense individual attention from the
teacher, resulting in superior performance and results.  It's a tried and
true method that's been working just fine for centuries, and nobody sees a
reason to change it any time soon.  

<MAPEND>

[*Daily Blessing*] 2358/4698 HP  1935/5105 MP  1905/1905 mv  789tnl (Reply: Yerald) 
Lv 158  G 770221 | A Classroom (E)
>>
A Long Hallway
  This is a rather cheerful hallway- the wooden walls are painted in sunny
yellow with purple doors.  Every inch of the floor is covered by a bright,
electric green carpet.  Don't blame the senior members of the Guild- the
students vote on the color scheme every year.  Bulletin boards in between
the doors are tacked with schedules and artwork and notices, and every
afternoon after classes, the pupils police the corridor so that it's fresh
for the next day's studies.  The schedule is fairly easy- three hours of
classes in the morning, two in the afternoon.  Of course, plenty of the
other hours are taken up by the hated drills in the training field.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2358/4698 HP  1935/5105 MP  1905/1905 mv  789tnl (Reply: Yerald)
